Time and time again, Donald Trump has abused his power in an attempt to overturn the results of a free and fair election and undermine the integrity of our democracy.

That’s why I’m proud to join my colleagues in calling for impeachment. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ErKwIYgW8AEUODu.jpg

Fourteen hours and one violent insurrection later, I voted to certify the results of the Presidential election. 

Tomorrow, the fight for democracy begins anew. Tonight, I’m going to get some sleep.

RT @MehdiHasanShow .@MondaireJones on the GOP's role in the storming of the Capitol: "They are co-conspirators in sedition, along with the President of the United States, who, of course, has been the cheerleader, the main cheerleader, for the violent insurrection that we saw attempted today." http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ErG0SOIWMAIEIj8.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1347055873714221057/vid/480x270/nWy3CxHOprG7tNMy.mp4?tag=13
Congressman LaTurner is following the advice of the House physician and CDC guidelines and, therefore, does not plan to return to the House floor for votes until he is cleared to do so.

Late Wednesday evening, Congressman Jake LaTurner received a positive test result for COVID-19. 

Congressman LaTurner took the test as part of Washington DC’s travel guidelines that requires visitors be tested. He is not experiencing any symptoms at this time.

Here is my statement on the Electoral College certification votes that took place yesterday and today. https://bentz.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-cliff-bentz-statement-electoral-college-certification

RT @RepLeeZeldin Simon & Schuster is promoting democracy by silencing a Republican’s book highlighting how big tech is silencing Republicans?

It is so dishonest for anyone to try to define Hawley’s purpose yesterday as being about “insurrection”, “treason” or “sedition”. 
https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/07/books/simon-schuster-josh-hawley-book.html

Twitter thinks it’s ok to ban @realDonaldTrump but allows this tweet from Iran’s supreme leader that’s clearly inciting violence against America to stand? This is not acceptable! https://twitter.com/khamenei_ir/status/1339164261982097409 QT @khamenei_ir Millions attending Martyrs Soleimani & Abu Mahdi’s funerals in Iraq & Iran was the 1st severe slap to the US. But the worse one is overcoming the hegemony of Arrogance & expelling the US from the region. Of course, revenge will be taken on those who ordered it & the murderers.

Sadly, this is just the latest example of big tech silencing conservatives. This is unacceptable and should not happen. Our society thrives when all opinions are heard and debated, not when many are silenced.

Big tech should not censor the leader of the free world and restrict his ability to communicate directly to the American people, especially during a critical moment in our nation such as right now. Facebook and Twitter should restore @realDonaldTrump’s accounts immediately!

I look forward to working with my colleagues on legislation to create an election commission that could lead to important reforms. Moving forward, I will continue to be a voice for the people of Alabama regarding the security of our elections.
Although the election results were not what many Alabamians - including myself - would like, the process of certifying the election results needs to be completed.
Because I promised to raise these concerns on behalf of my constituents, I voted against seating the electors from Arizona and Pennsylvania.

The integrity of our elections is vital to our country. I have serious concerns that the states of Arizona and Pennsylvania did not act in accordance with their own duly enacted laws when conducting this election.

Yesterday was a sad day for our great country. I strongly condemn the violence and actions we saw from those who stormed the Capitol. It undermines the freedoms we enjoy as Americans, and it has no place in our democracy.
RT @Jim_Jordan God Bless the men and women of law enforcement.

I condemn all violence.

I support election integrity.

These two aren’t mutually exclusive and I believe in both of these.

Last night, I continued with my objection to the submission of electors’ from six states to protect election security. 

https://good.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-bob-goods-statement-electoral-college-certification-vote http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ErJWlrmXMAIHSUE.jpg

Much can happen in 13 days. We must remove President Trump from office NOW. The riot incited by the President yesterday was unpatriotic and a disgrace to our core values. I support invoking the 25th Amendment .

Thank you @LeaderHoyer for this tribute. Yesterday showed how important it is to build and protect the “Beloved Community” Congressman Lewis envisioned. I am in Congress to do just that! https://twitter.com/LeaderHoyer/status/1347227669654630401 QT @LeaderHoyer While rioters shamefully destroyed this tribute to my brother John Lewis yesterday, let his words continue to echo in the halls of Congress and in our hearts. Let us always stand up, speak up, and speak out against injustice and for our democracy. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ErJQYetXYAI_6Up.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ErJQYetXMAEFPdq.jpg

I would have never imagined I wouldn't be safe in the U.S. Capitol or any federal building. But thankfully, domestic terrorism cannot and will not stop the peaceful transfer of power, ensuring Joe Biden is the next POTUS.

Congress upheld the will of America’s voters and the sanctity of the democratic process. I am proud my colleagues in the House and Senate were able to move forward with the process, despite a domestic terrorist attack on the U.S. Capitol. Read my statement below: http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ErHeOf5XcAEZvaN.jpg

This President is a threat to the people and our democracy. We are resolved to do everything we can to remove him from office. I urge the Cabinet to invoke the 25th amendment.

We never know what this man is going to do. It’s always scary and yesterday it was deadly.

Like I told @thenewmexican — I am here. I will be here for as long as I need to serve New Mexico. 

https://www.santafenewmexican.com/news/local_news/n-m-congressional-delegates-remain-defiant-after-violent-capitol-incident/article_cfc241ba-5070-11eb-8e8c-0bcbf3bb8136.html

We certified the election results. Trump lost at the ballot box & in the courts. Violence lost and Democracy won. 

We performed our constitutional duty. Now it’s time to create opportunities for our communities. We must focus on beating this pandemic & fixing our economy.
I am sitting in the House as the certificate of New Mexico's 5 electoral votes were reported and tallied for Joseph R Biden for President and Kamala Harris for Vice President!

America can, and must, be better than what we witnessed yesterday. 

I pray that she will be. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ErIsXYKW8AEns50.jpg

Not what I expected for my first @HouseForeign committee meeting - an emergency session on yesterday's attack on our democracy - but grateful to Chairman @RepGregoryMeeks for his quick action getting us together. Our work has never been more urgent. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ErKwVT9XIAI4dgR.jpg

24 hours after our democracy was attacked, this much is clear:
- President Trump should be impeached
- Everyone responsible should be held accountable to the highest level
- Congress should remain in session
- We need a full investigation into the complete security failure

It’s done. On January 20, we will inaugurate our new President and Vice President. 

No mob, no militia, no threats against our lives could stop us from certifying the votes of the American people.

@POTUS has done incredible things for our country & I share the disappointment of millions of Hoosiers in the outcome of the 2020 election, but ultimately, the recourse is with the American people, at the ballot box, in the next election as it has been for the last 200 years.
It’s a threat to our federalist system and would play into the hands of those seeking to end the electoral college.
Whatever the irregularities and politically motivated election law changes in certain states, two wrongs do not make a right, and Congress cannot overrule millions of votes certified by those states.

We are going through some turbulent and dangerous times in our history. I am extremely upset and worried about the future of our country as are many Hoosiers I represent, but my oath to our Constitution is paramount to the future of our Republic.

Hey Norma, I got tests from the Attending Physician once I was safely able to. Just called and he told me to come down and get tested immediately. 

I’m happy to walk you through the process if you need help figuring it out. I know it’s my first week here but it wasn’t that hard. https://twitter.com/NormaJTorres/status/1347065582752051201 QT @NormaJTorres Or in in the middle of a riot, when we are on lockdown. Defending our constitution. But please do tell us where can we get a COVID test in the middle of chaos? https://twitter.com/normajtorres/status/1347065025953988608

Both tests were negative, and I currently do not have symptoms. In consultation with the Sergeant at Arms and Attending Physician, I will vote in a safe, socially distanced manner for the rest of this evening.
Today I learned I may have been exposed to COVID-19. After today’s events, I was able to take two tests, which unfortunately conflicted with the time of the first vote tonight.

In case you missed it, here is my full speech from early this morning during the House debate on the objection to Pennsylvania's electoral votes. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EbTWlBRWR7k&feature=youtu.be

We survived an attempted coup yesterday at the Capitol.

I’m a member of Congress and l have not received any kind of security briefing since then.

Why was our government so outrageously and dangerously unprepared to deal with an attack we knew was coming?

This is a step in the right direction. We need to get small businesses back open and Minnesota's economy back on track! https://www.startribune.com/minnesota-gov-tim-walz-loosens-restrictions-on-indoor-dining-other-venues/600007280/

My prayers go out to the officer’s family. 

Those responsible for the officer’s death must be prosecuted.

What occurred on Capitol Hill was a perversion of patriotism.

Las objeciones a las listas de electores son una herramienta utilizada en el Congreso para resaltar la necesidad de reformas electorales. Ahora debemos unir nuestra nacion. Me comprometo a trabajar con el presidente electo Biden el 20 de enero. Leer más aquí: http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ErJldiVXIAEAUbE.jpg

Objections to slates of electors are a common tool used in Congress to highlight the need for electoral reforms. Florida learned those lessons in 2000.

Now we must move forward as a nation & heal. I pledge to work with President-elect Biden on January 20th. Read more here: http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ErJfyudXYAYJYBt.jpg

Based on the law, the Constitution, and my conscience, I cannot support certifying votes from any state that violated the Constitution. This decision is not about loyalty to a President – it’s about my fidelity to the Constitution and the oath that I swore.
This proceeding is not just about the integrity of this election, it is about ensuring the integrity of all future elections.

We either believe, according to statute, that every elector was ‘lawfully certified’ and ‘regularly given,’ or we don’t. States certainly have broad delegated powers to administer federal elections, but they still must operate within the bounds of the Constitution.
The Law and the Constitution give Congress not only the authority, but I believe the responsibility, to serve as the last check on the integrity of our presidential elections.

My conversation with Kennedy concerning yesterday's events. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1347270971267444738/img/RcIyQxR_wVToFvyg.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1347270971267444738/vid/480x270/dnaKLQF7hEh_0q3J.mp4?tag=13
We are far better than what we saw last summer and today. We can now prove that we are the America my friend believed – and I believe – is better.

Now, our country must come together. Our nation can get this right. That is overdue as well. My good friend in Congress Elijah Cummings told me time and again that “America is better than this.” We lost Elijah last year, but his words are as true as ever.

As the violence in the Capitol today was indefensible, so, too, was the willful destruction of so many neighborhoods and towns last summer. And yet, widespread consensus that condemned these nationwide riots was elusive. America deserved better this summer and didn’t get it.

Serious crimes were committed and a life was tragically lost. Our nation deserves far better. This is a time to give our all, honor our institutions and uphold our American democracy. Let's speak with one voice in making that a national consensus.

The violence and turmoil we witnessed in Washington today was completely unacceptable. Nothing could possibly justify it. The disturbing images of protesters on the House and Senate floors will not soon be forgotten. Nor should they.
I want to share some thoughts on the sad and tragic events of the day
